vocabulary.definition: an exciting experience or journey
vocabulary.example: We went on an adventure to explore the forest

vocabulary.definition: to find something for the first time
vocabulary.example: Scientists discover new animals in the ocean

vocabulary.definition: to travel and learn about new places
vocabulary.example: Let's explore the mysterious cave

vocabulary.definition: able to make new and interesting things
vocabulary.example: She drew a creative picture with bright colors

vocabulary.definition: special and different from everything else
vocabulary.example: Every snowflake has a unique pattern

vocabulary.definition: very surprising and wonderful
vocabulary.example: The fireworks made an amazing display in the sky

vocabulary.definition: a trip from one place to another
vocabulary.example: The journey to grandma's house takes two hours

vocabulary.definition: being brave when something is scary
vocabulary.example: It takes courage to speak in front of many people

vocabulary.definition: to do something special for a happy event
vocabulary.example: We celebrate birthdays with cake and presents

vocabulary.definition: a special relationship between people who care about each other
vocabulary.example: Their friendship lasted for many years

vocabulary.definition: to think about something or feel amazed
vocabulary.example: I wonder what's inside that mysterious box

vocabulary.definition: wanting to learn or know about something
vocabulary.example: The curious cat investigated every corner of the room

vocabulary.definition: something very valuable and special
vocabulary.example: The pirates searched for buried treasure

vocabulary.definition: very old, from long ago
vocabulary.example: The ancient castle was built hundreds of years ago

vocabulary.definition: something that is hard to understand or explain
vocabulary.example: The missing cookies were a mystery until we found crumbs

vocabulary.definition: caring deeply about others and wanting to help them
vocabulary.example: She showed compassion by helping the injured bird

vocabulary.definition: extremely beautiful and impressive
vocabulary.example: The magnificent waterfall took our breath away

vocabulary.definition: extremely interesting and captivating
vocabulary.example: The documentary about wolves was fascinating

vocabulary.definition: very unusual and remarkable
vocabulary.example: Her extraordinary talent amazed everyone

vocabulary.definition: difficult to understand or explain
vocabulary.example: The mysterious footprints led into the dark forest

vocabulary.definition: the ability to create pictures and ideas in your mind
vocabulary.example: Her imagination helped her write wonderful stories

vocabulary.definition: decided to do something and not giving up
vocabulary.example: The determined athlete practiced every day

vocabulary.definition: to understand the value of something good
vocabulary.example: We should appreciate the beautiful sunset

vocabulary.definition: to know what something means
vocabulary.example: I understand how to solve this math problem

vocabulary.definition: amazing and hard to believe
vocabulary.example: The acrobat did an incredible flip in the air

vocabulary.definition: having a job or duty to take care of something
vocabulary.example: Taking care of a pet is a big responsibility

vocabulary.definition: willing to give and share with others
vocabulary.example: The generous neighbor shared vegetables from her garden

vocabulary.definition: to complete or finish something successfully
vocabulary.example: She was proud to accomplish her goal of reading 50 books

vocabulary.definition: the natural world around us
vocabulary.example: We should protect our environment by recycling

vocabulary.definition: to give or add something to help
vocabulary.example: Everyone can contribute to making the school better

vocabulary.definition: lasting forever and not changing
vocabulary.example: The permanent marker won't wash off easily

vocabulary.definition: to share ideas and feelings with others
vocabulary.example: Animals communicate in many different ways

vocabulary.definition: working together to achieve something
vocabulary.example: The project required cooperation from the whole team

vocabulary.definition: a chance to do something good
vocabulary.example: Learning to play piano is a wonderful opportunity

vocabulary.definition: able to do things by yourself
vocabulary.example: She became more independent when she learned to ride a bike

vocabulary.definition: to make something new
vocabulary.example: Let's create a colorful poster for our project

vocabulary.definition: to keep someone or something safe
vocabulary.example: We wear helmets to protect our heads when riding bikes

vocabulary.definition: to make something better
vocabulary.example: Reading every day helps improve your vocabulary

vocabulary.definition: to put things in order or plan something
vocabulary.example: She likes to organize her books by color

vocabulary.definition: to do something many times to get better at it
vocabulary.example: He needs to practice piano for his recital

vocabulary.definition: to watch something carefully
vocabulary.example: Scientists observe animals in their natural habitat

vocabulary.definition: to try to win against others
vocabulary.example: Many students compete in the spelling bee

vocabulary.definition: to do something in front of other people
vocabulary.example: The dancers will perform on stage tonight

vocabulary.definition: to help someone understand something
vocabulary.example: The teacher will explain how to solve the math problem

vocabulary.definition: to know or remember someone or something
vocabulary.example: I can recognize my friend's voice on the phone

vocabulary.definition: to make someone want to do something good
vocabulary.example: The brave firefighter inspired him to help others

vocabulary.definition: to help someone feel brave or confident
vocabulary.example: My parents encourage me to try new things

vocabulary.definition: things that you know and understand
vocabulary.example: Reading books increases your knowledge about the world

vocabulary.definition: a group of people who live in the same place
vocabulary.example: Our community came together to clean up the park

vocabulary.definition: something difficult that needs to be fixed
vocabulary.example: We worked together to solve the puzzle problem

vocabulary.definition: an answer to a problem
vocabulary.example: She found a creative solution to fix the broken toy

vocabulary.definition: the power to be active and do things
vocabulary.example: After eating breakfast, I have lots of energy to play

vocabulary.definition: the ability to remember things
vocabulary.example: That song brings back a happy memory of summer camp

vocabulary.definition: a feeling of being very happy and eager
vocabulary.example: There was great excitement when the circus came to town

vocabulary.definition: something that happens to you
vocabulary.example: Going to the zoo was an amazing experience

vocabulary.definition: something new that someone creates
vocabulary.example: The bicycle was an important invention for transportation

vocabulary.definition: something that is made or built
vocabulary.example: Her art creation won first prize in the contest

vocabulary.definition: something special that families do every year
vocabulary.example: Baking cookies together is our family tradition

vocabulary.definition: a happy party or special event
vocabulary.example: The graduation celebration lasted all evening

vocabulary.definition: very smart or very bright
vocabulary.example: She had a brilliant idea for the science project

vocabulary.definition: good at thinking and learning quickly
vocabulary.example: The clever fox found a way out of the trap

vocabulary.definition: feeling sure about yourself and your abilities
vocabulary.example: She felt confident before giving her presentation

vocabulary.definition: happy and in a good mood
vocabulary.example: His cheerful smile brightened everyone's day

vocabulary.definition: able to wait calmly without getting upset
vocabulary.example: The patient teacher helped every student learn

vocabulary.definition: willing to help others
vocabulary.example: My helpful neighbor brought us soup when we were sick

vocabulary.definition: always telling the truth
vocabulary.example: The honest boy admitted he broke the window

vocabulary.definition: faithful and true to someone or something
vocabulary.example: The loyal dog waited for his owner every day

vocabulary.definition: caring about other people's feelings
vocabulary.example: It was thoughtful of her to remember my birthday

vocabulary.definition: treating others with kindness and good manners
vocabulary.example: The respectful student always listened when others spoke

vocabulary.definition: doing well and achieving your goals
vocabulary.example: The successful athlete won three gold medals

vocabulary.definition: to look for information and try to find out the truth
vocabulary.example: The detective will investigate the mysterious case

vocabulary.definition: to show how something works or is done
vocabulary.example: The chef will demonstrate how to make perfect pasta

vocabulary.definition: to change or affect how someone thinks or acts
vocabulary.example: Good friends can influence you to make better choices

vocabulary.definition: to convince someone to do or believe something
vocabulary.example: She tried to persuade her parents to get a puppy

vocabulary.definition: to focus your attention on something
vocabulary.example: I need to concentrate when doing my math homework

vocabulary.definition: to judge how good or valuable something is
vocabulary.example: The judges will evaluate each science fair project

vocabulary.definition: to work together with others on something
vocabulary.example: The students collaborate on their group presentation

vocabulary.definition: to expect something to happen
vocabulary.example: We anticipate that the weather will be sunny tomorrow

vocabulary.definition: to take part in an activity with others
vocabulary.example: Everyone can participate in the school talent show

vocabulary.definition: to successfully complete or reach a goal
vocabulary.example: With hard work, you can achieve anything you set your mind to

vocabulary.definition: the kind of person you are inside
vocabulary.example: Her honest character made her a trusted friend

vocabulary.definition: your way of looking at or thinking about something
vocabulary.example: From my perspective, we should help clean up the playground

vocabulary.definition: something good that you accomplish
vocabulary.example: Learning to read was her greatest achievement in first grade

vocabulary.definition: the process of growing or getting better
vocabulary.example: The development of her art skills took years of practice

vocabulary.definition: working hard and not giving up
vocabulary.example: His dedication to studying helped him become a doctor

vocabulary.definition: the ability to recover from difficult times
vocabulary.example: Her resilience helped her bounce back after losing the game

vocabulary.definition: continuing to try even when things are hard
vocabulary.example: With perseverance, she finally learned to ride her bike

vocabulary.definition: feeling very excited and interested in something
vocabulary.example: Her enthusiasm for reading inspired other students

vocabulary.definition: the ability to learn and understand things
vocabulary.example: His intelligence showed when he solved the difficult puzzle

vocabulary.definition: the ability to become something great in the future
vocabulary.example: The young artist has great potential to become famous

vocabulary.definition: complex and advanced
vocabulary.example: The sophisticated robot could perform many different tasks

vocabulary.definition: good at studying and understanding things carefully
vocabulary.example: Her analytical mind helped her solve complex problems

vocabulary.definition: creating new and creative ideas
vocabulary.example: The innovative inventor created a new type of bicycle

vocabulary.definition: having big goals and working hard to achieve them
vocabulary.example: The ambitious student wanted to become a scientist

vocabulary.definition: good at solving problems between people peacefully
vocabulary.example: The diplomatic student helped friends solve their argument

vocabulary.definition: caring about other people's feelings and needs
vocabulary.example: The considerate boy shared his lunch with a hungry classmate

vocabulary.definition: good at finding creative ways to solve problems
vocabulary.example: The resourceful girl used cardboard boxes to build a fort

vocabulary.definition: able to change and adjust to new situations
vocabulary.example: The adaptable student did well at her new school

vocabulary.definition: very careful and paying attention to small details
vocabulary.example: The meticulous artist spent hours perfecting every brushstroke

vocabulary.definition: always doing your best work and being responsible
vocabulary.example: The conscientious student always completed homework on time
